intro: Tithymalus uralensis, commonly known as Siberian tithymale, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Eastern Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its flowers, which range from white to pale yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Tithymalus uralensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
